Body: Let it be known first that the Romans called their deity Jove and Juppiter as much as they called him Deuppiter (deum + pater: gods'-father). Furthermore, Iuppiter is not an example of an affricate, which the Romans had none (and therefore is not comparable to "giorno" or "jour"), but the "d" was merely supplanted by the palatial approximate. Your quandary of Zeus can likely be explained by an origin in common with θεός (theos, god)). It's not a complete answer, but I hope it points in the right direction.
